docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
I am currently a tenured Professor and the Associate Thrust Head in the Data Science and Anaytics （数据科学与分析学域）, Information Hub （信息枢纽）, The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou), and I am also an affiliated Professor at HKUST. Previously, I was a Redbird Visiting Professor in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering, HKUST, and a Professor in the School of Computer Science and Engineering, University of New South Wales, Australia.

Contact

  • Email: weiwcs AT ust.hk
  • Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=wLtu3FYAAAAJ&hl=en
  • Github: https://github.com/DBAIWangGroup

docs.title: Research
docs.text:
My research areas include Databases, Algorithms, Artificial Intelligence and Cross-disciplinary Topics. I have published research papers in these areas, with a majority of them in prestigious international journal and conferences.

I have won several awards, including SIGSPATIAL Best Vision Paper, ICASSP 2023 Top 3% Paper, SIGCOMM 2022 Best Paper, ICMR 2021 Best Paper and DASFAA 2016 Best Student Paper awards. In addition, several pieces of my research have been deployed in industrial projects and products.

My current research interests are:

  • Integration of database and artificial intelligence technologies, including learned indexes, learned algorithms and optimizations, and intelligent data preprocess and postprocessing (e.g., data cleansing/integration and NLP interface for DB/applications).
  • Machine Learning and Deep Learning, including Large Language Models, Natural Language Processing, Knowledge graphs, Security issues of deep learning models (e.g, adversarial attacks and defense).
  • Understanding high-dimensional data, including its structure, properties, and algorithms (e.g., vector databases).
  • Cross-disciplinary research and applications, including Material Informatics (e.g., material property prediction, material design, physics-informed neural networks, sybmolic regression, etc.), AI for Science (e.g., neural operator learning for solving PDEs), and AI for Education.

Also see

  • my Google Scholar page for a fairly up-to-date, manually curated list of publications --- my name is a challenge for Named Entity Disambiguation (e.g., "The base name with the most different numeric suffixes (i.e., identified authors) is Wei Wang" and motivated me to work on Entity Resolution
  • my GitHub page for a list of code repositories for my teaching and research.

docs.title: Teaching
docs.text:
• I am the Computer Science Coordinator of HKUST(GZ), in charge of all Computer Science-related courses in the first two years for our UG students.
  • I am also overseeing teaching related issues (including teaching innovation and teaching quality) in the DSA thrust, HKUST(GZ).
  • Currently, we are building AI4Edu systems based on Large Language Models, with the aim to explore new learning paradigms.

docs.title: Service
docs.text:
I am an Associate Editor of IEEE TKDE, Journal of Material Informatics, and Data Science and Engineering. I also served as PC Co-chairs of IEEE BigData 2023 and APWeb 2012, PC Vice-chairs of ICDE 2014 and 2018. I also served in other organizational roles in many conferences and workshops, as well as reviewers and PC members for major journals and conferences.

I am the Vice Directors of Guangzhou Municipal Key Laboratory of Materials Informatics, Guangzhou Municipal Key Laboratory of Electronic Design Automation, Guangzhou Municipal Key Laboratory of Big Data and Intelligence. I am the Council Member of Guangzhou Intelligent Networking and New Energy Automobile Industry Talent Federation.

docs.title: Prospective Student
docs.text: I am always looking for curious and motivated PhD/MPhil/RA/Visiting student to join our lab at HKUST(GZ). Please read this post for the current vacancy (2025).

docs.title: Points to Ponder
docs.text:
• Cargo Cult Science, by RICHARD P. FEYNMAN.

  • The illustrated guide to a Ph.D., by Matthew Might.

  • The Art of Research Paper Writing and the Research Iceberg Analogy, by Tadayoshi Kohno.
  • In the era of human-level AI, what is the relevant and novel research then?

docs.title: Mottos
docs.text:
• “Study hard what interests you the most in the most undisciplined, irreverent and original manner possible.” – Richard Feynmann

  • "Every morning in the early part of October 1843, on my coming down to breakfast, your brother William Edwin and yourself used to ask me: "Well, Papa, can you multiply triples?" Whereto I was always obliged to reply, with a sad shake of the head, "No, I can only add and subtract them." – History of quaternions (Wikipedia)

  • “Failure is a good option, if you are not failing you're not trying hard enough.” ― Elon Musk

  • “Any fool can make something complicated. It takes a genius to make it simple.” ― Woody Guthrie

  • “The path isn't a straight line; it’s a spiral. You continually come back to things you thought you understood and see deeper truths.” ― Barry H. Gillespie

  • “苟日新，日日新，又日新” ― 《礼记·大学》

  • “庖丁解牛；惟手熟尔” ― 《庄子・养生主》；《卖油翁》

  • “To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all.” ― Oscar Wilde

docs.title: AI for Science
docs.text:
I am working on

  • AI-based method to solve Partial Differential Equations (PDEs)
    • Solving PDEs on arbitrary geometry based on Multi-graph neural operator
    • Combining Algebraic Multigrid and Multi-wavelet methods
    • Utilizing Level Set methods

docs.title: Database Research
docs.text:
I am currently working on

  • DB + AI:
    • Learned indexes
    • LSH-based indexes
  • Vector Databases
    • Efficient and scalable index construction
    • Efficient query processing
  • Data Management issue for High-dimensional or Metric Spaces
  • Graph
  • Misc

docs.title: Large Language Model Research
docs.text:
I am currently working on

  • Small LLM:
    • Distillation-based approach
  • Memory mechanism in LLMs
    • Learning to Edit
  • Alignment:
    • BMC
    • Natural evolution
  • Deep inference with LLMs
    • Domain-specific deep inference
  • Unified Question Answering
    • Beyond RAG
  • Misc

docs.title: PhD
docs.text:
Several PhD positions with full scholarships are available. The PhD program at the Guangzhou campus has the same academic structure with the Clear Water Bay campus, including English as the teaching language, the same PhD graduate certificate, a highly competitive scholarship, etc.

HKUST(GZ) creates an exceptional opportunity for new resources, organizational structure and physical settings needed for the systematic development of cross-disciplinary programs in concert with the disciplinary-oriented efforts on the HKUST Clear Water Bay campus. Under the Unified HKUST-Complementary Campuses umbrella, academic structures and degree programs are differentiated, the overall infrastructures substantially enlarged and updated, and courses and central research facilities open to students and researchers both ways. Even though the two campuses are of separate legal entities and financial frameworks, faculty are encouraged and supported to collaborate and co-supervise students, and students will have opportunities to pursue degrees offered by both campuses. This way, members of both campuses will freely choose their research topics and related studies with University’s overall enlarged scope, with more flexibility and better support.

One can find more information about the PhD program at HKUST(GZ) here.

docs.title: The Supervisor
docs.text:
Prof. Wei Wang is a Professor in the Information Hub, HKUST(GZ). Before that, he was a Red Bird Visiting Professor at HKUST, and a Professor in the School of Computer Science and Engineering, UNSW, Australia.

His current research areas include:

  • Integration of DB/System and AI (DB+AI),
  • Large Language Models,
  • Machine/Deep Learning, and
  • Cross-disciplinary research (Material Genomics, AI for Science/Education, etc.).

For more details, please refer to Prof. Wang's homepage.

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
1. Esssential requirements

  2. Bechalor/Master degree in a reputable institute in relevant disciplines

  3. High ethnical and academic standards, honesty and good at communication (oral and written)
  4. Self-motivated and life-long learning

  5. Uploading a high academic standard and able to work under pressure

  6. Minimum language requirements

  7. TOEFL 550 (pBT) or 80 (iBT, in one single attempt)

  8. IELTS (Academic Module): Overall 6.5, and all sub-scores: 5.5

  9. Additional preferences

  10. Excellent maths and programming skills

  11. Publications in top conferences or journals
  12. Salient characteristics, such as strong curiosity, independent thinking, or “hungary and foolish".

docs.title: 香港科技大学（广州）数据管理/机器学习 2025全奖PhD学生
docs.text:
王炜 —— 香港科技大学（广州）信息枢纽终身正教授。王炜教授正招收多名全奖博士生，现在至2025年秋季或2026年春季入学均可。港科大广州校区与港科大香港校区将在各学科和领域上积极合作，港科大广州的特色在于融合学科（具体介绍请见学校网站）。港科大广州校区的学术制度和香港清水湾校区相同，包括同样的毕业证书，有竞争力的博士奖学金等。

申请详细信息参见：https://hkust-gz.edu.cn/admission/scholarships-and-fees

docs.title: 导师简介
docs.text:
王炜教授是香港科技大学（广州）信息枢纽终生正教授。此前他在澳大利亚新南威尔士大学计算机科学与工程系担任终生正教授，拥有超过21年丰富的教学及研究经验。

他目前的研究方向为数据库与人工智能技术融合（DB+AI），大语言模型，机器学习与深度学习，以及跨学科的研究工作（例如AI和材料，科学与教育的结合）。他的绝大部分论文发表在计算机顶级会议和期刊上（例如SIGMOD, VLDB,ICDE，WWW、AAAI、IJCAI, SIGIR，TODS， VLDBJ， TKDE），并获得SIGSPATIAL 2024最佳愿景论文奖，ICASSP 2023, SIGCOMM 2022, ICMR 2021最佳论文奖和DASFAA 2016最近学生论文奖。他现任顶级期刊TKDE, DSE, Journal of Material Informatics的副编辑，并多个国际顶级会议中担任重要组织者（例如近期的IEEE BigData 2023程序委员会主席, ICDE19和ICDE14程序委员会副主席，EDBT19最佳论文委员会委员等）。他多次在顶级会议中做演讲及辅导报告（例如KDD21和VLDB20）。他在澳洲工作时持续获得多项1类（Category 1）研究项目资助（包括7个ARC Discovery Projects，其中4个是独立申请主持）以及大量工业界项目（为澳洲多个国家政府部门构建了专有的知识图谱系统及智能应用）。

docs.title: 导师主页
docs.text: http://wei-wang.net

docs.title: 学校简介
docs.text:
香港科技大学成立于1991年，是一所世界级的国际研究型大学。在2025年，港科大位列QS世界大学排名第47位和《自然》期刊指数的专利影响力指标（2022 年) 大中华区第一, 以及在2022年《新财富》深科技独角兽孵化能力中排名大中华区第二。出处

香港科技大学（广州）是港科大的最新的校区，位于大湾区中心广州南沙庆盛交通枢纽。在“港科大一体，两校互补”的总体规划框架下，港科大（广州）的学位课程将聚集融合学科专题领域，与香港科技大学清水湾校园错位发展，透过灵活及充分发挥与清水湾校园的协同效应，力求将香港科技大学的教育和科研优势提升至更高水平。借助清水湾校学科主导的学术根基，香港科技大学（广州）将采用全新的教学模式，设立功能、信息、系统和社会四个学术枢纽，将先进材料、地球与海洋大气科学、微电子、人工智能、物联网、生命科学与生物医学工程、智能交通、机器人与自主系统、智能制造和金融科技等16个前沿研究领域纳入独特、非传统的枢纽结构，清晰实现并有效提供融合学科学术制度的建设成果，赋予教职员及学生糅合不同专业知识和探索融合学科前沿研究及其创新领域的能力，及孕育从容应对全球问题的崭新方案。

docs.title: 申请要求
docs.text:
（1）基本要求

  • 重点院校理工科专业的学士/硕士学位
  • 品格端正，诚信为首，乐于沟通（书面及口头）
  • 有一定的自我驱动和自我学习能力
  • 有较好的抗压能力和较高的自我要求

（2）语言要求

  • 良好的英文水平：托福550分（纸考）/80（机考）及以上 或 雅思6.5，均分不低于5.5

（3）其他要求

  • 优秀的数学和编程能力
  • 发表过相关领域顶会论文优先
  • 有强烈科研好奇心，独立思考精神或自我挑战者优先

docs.title: VLDB20 - Similarity Query Processing
docs.text: This is the resource page for our VLDB 2020 tutorial titled "Similarity Query Processing for High-Dimensional Data" by Jianbin Qin, Wei Wang, Chuan Xiao, and Ying Zhang.

docs.title: Paper
docs.text: Jianbin Qin, Wei Wang, Chuan Xiao, Ying Zhang: Similarity Query Processing for High-Dimensional Data. Proc. VLDB Endow. 13(12): 3437-3440 (2020) pdf

docs.title: Abstract
docs.text:
Similarity query processing has been an active research topic for several decades. It is an essential procedure in a wide range of applications. Recently, embedding and auto-encoding methods as well as pre-trained models have gained popularity. They basically deal with high-dimensional data, and this trend brings new opportunities and challenges to similarity query processing for high-dimensional data. Meanwhile, new techniques have emerged to tackle this long-standing problem theoretically and empirically.

In this tutorial, we summarize existing solutions, especially recent advancements from both database (DB) and machine learning (ML) communities, and analyze their strengths and weaknesses. We review exact and approximate methods such as cover tree, locality sensitive hashing, product quantization, and proximity graphs. We also discuss the selectivity estimation problem and show how researchers are bringing in state-of-the-art ML techniques to address the problem. By highlighting the strong connections between DB and ML, we hope that this tutorial provides an impetus towards new ML for DB solutions and vice versa.

docs.title: Slides
docs.text:
Slides (updated on 4 Sept 2020):

  1. Introduction
  2. Exact Query Processing
  3. Approximate-1
  4. Approximate-2
  5. Approximate-3
  6. Estimation
  7. Open Problems
